intro: Trigonella macroanguina, commonly known as the broad-leafed fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and marshy areas. Its flowers are small and yellow, and it produces cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. The botanical features of Trigonella macroanguina make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland habitats.
